args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor Chapter 11 of the main campaign.
You heard me, but lemme say it plainâ€”\nyou need to clear outta the castle.
I'M the leader of the Halidom now!
Hey! Are you insulting the rokkan\npeople, you woodland wimp?!
What large words to spill from the mouth\nof such a small and insignificant being.
Okay, let's all just slow our collective\nrolls for a hot second, yeah?

Okay, that is not a slow rollâ€”in fact,
it's the exact OPPOSITE of a slow roll.
Now just take a couple of breaths and
tell ol' Luca what happened.
Thank you for saving me, Luca.\nI had no idea they'd get so angry\nover something like that.
Yeah, it can be tough for new cultures\nto come together sometimes, but I think\nthey've got it figured out now.
Hey there! How ya been?\nAnything causin' trouble?
Ah, Luca. Perfect timing.\nI have something to tell you...
We got us a right huge family runnin'\naround the castle these days.
Dude, for reals! Makes me sorta miss\nthe days when it was just a few of us.
Unfortunately, more people has meant\na few more problems for us to deal with.
I hear ya, boss. Some'a these races are\nhavin' a real hard time makin' nice.
We've got humans, sylvans, and rokkans\nall smushed together into a big ol' stew.

Yeah, but it ain't altogether unexpected.
I mean, even folks from the same race
think differently depending on their
backgrounds and whatnot.
So when ya throw a few different races\nin the mix, it just makes it that much\ntrickier what to suss it all out.
I'm thankful we've had Luca around.\nHis peacemaking abilities have really\nkept this pot from boiling over.
I know, right? Luca of all people!
Uh oh. Sounds like somebody's\ntalkin' about me outta school.
Actually, we were just talking about how\nmuch of a help you've been lately.
Yeah, I probably woulda strangled\nsomebody by now if not for you.
Yeah, so don't be a paranoid weirdo!\nIt's all good stuff.
Whoa, okay! Let's all just back the\ncompliments down a peg, yeah?\nAll the attention makes me sweaty.
So what's yer secret, Luca?\nWhy the big change?

Ya ain't never been much of a
peacemaker. Yer more the type
what to throw a few stink bombs
and chuckle all the way to the bank.
It's because I made a promise to build\na world where people didn't have to fight.
Ah, yes. Your promise to Mascula.
Yeah. But to be honest, I ain't even sure\nHOW to start makin' a place like that.
So I decided to start by challenging the\nconventions in front of me.
It's stupid to think people have to be a\ncertain way just because they happen to\nbe sylvan or human or whatever, yeah?
So I thought maybe if I could convince\nfolks to drop their prejudices, we'd be\none step closer to that world.
So THAT'S why ya keep buttin' in\nwhenever two races are goin' at it!
That's a surprisingly deep thought, Luca.\nYou sure you're feeling okay?
Ha ha, very funny. But I'm serious here.\nAnd it doesn't stop with raceâ€”it extends\nall the way to entire nations.
ï¼‚This happened because Alberia.ï¼‚\nï¼‚This happened because Dyrenell.ï¼‚\nWe've gotta stop thinkin' like that.
I know it sounds like a pipe dream,\nbut I'm committed to seein' it happen.
Damn those sylvans! We've no choice\nbut to pull back and regroup.
How are we faring on this side, Luca?
All aces! The Empire is retreating.
Good. Then let us leave the rear guard\nfor now and return home.
You go on without me, yeah?\nI got somethin' to take care of.
I'll make itâ€”but you look pale as death.\nBetter get that wound treated fast.
No time for healing or griping now.\nThe New Alberian Army will withdraw\nsoon, so we just gotta tough it out.
Gya! It's the enemy! To arms!
Hang on! I ain't here to fight!
I know your face. You're Lucaâ€”a right-\nhand man to the traitor prince himself.\nWhy would I believe anything you say?
Okay, fine. I get that you don't trust me.\nBut I just came to give you something.

...Here. This salve is a special sylvan
medicine that should take care of both
your woundsâ€”which look VERY nasty,
by the way. Blech.
Why would you help an enemy?
I mean, obviously I'm gonna fight for\nthe things that are important to meâ€”\nthat's non-negotiable.
But fightin' someone just 'cause they're\nfrom a different country or a different\nrace ain't somethin' I can get behind.
Folks are generally good-natured no\nmatter what side of a border they're from.\nHell, I bet the three of us could be pals!
Well then. If you're feeling so generous,\nI suppose you won't mind telling us how\nto make this medicine of yours?
That way, you can help the whole of the\nImperial Army, and not just the two of us.

Not possible? Unwise? Of course it is.
You'd be going out of your way to help
enemies who'd die on their own if you
simply leave them be.
Your whole ï¼‚people aren't badï¼‚ thing\nis pure selfishness. YOU choose who\nyou will save and who you will not.

What? No! That's not it at all! Look,
this medicine is VERY complicated
to make, and it's easy to mistake
one herb for another, so I don'tâ€”
So you can't teach us stupid humans how\nto make it? What a sylvan thing to think!\nClearly you don't trust us at all.
No! How can you say I don't trustâ€”
All your words and thoughts come\nfrom a sylvan point of view.
When you said we could ï¼‚be pals,ï¼‚\nyou might as well have said we could\nbe the beloved pet to you, the master!
That's how you think you'll take away the\nbarriers of race and country? What a joke!
The hell are you DOING, Luca?!\nThe enemy's right in front of you!
So this was a ploy...to lower\nour guard...? Damn you...
Because you can't abandon...\nthe sylvan...part of you...
Saaay, nice duds! What's with the getup?
I got a rokkan blacksmith and a human\ncraftsman to make 'em for me.
Was there a reason for using two\nsuch disparate craftspeople?
It's so I don't forget that folks from ALL\nraces are lendin' me their strength.
When I fight, I want to be close enough\nto see the faces and hear the voices of\nmy foes.
So I asked Laxi to borrow Mascula's blade.
I need itâ€”I need ALL of thisâ€”so I don't\nforget what I'm strivin' for in the end.
